text: Jarosław Roman Szczepankiewicz is a Polish diplomat, serving as an ambassador to Ethiopia (2008–2012) and chargé d'affaires to the Philippines (since 2018). == Life == Jarosław Szczepankiewicz holds an M.A. in Oriental philosophy from the Catholic University of Lublin. He has been studying also at the Institut national des langues et civilisations orientales, Paris, the National School of Public Administration, Warsaw, the Netherlands Institute of International Relations Clingendael, the Hague, and the University of Paris. In 1998, Szczepankiewicz joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. He has been working as a Head of Task Force Group, Department of European Integration. Between 2001 and 2007 he was Head of Section at the Department of Promotion. From 2008 to 2012 he was holding the post of the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Poland to the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, accredited also to the Republic of Djibouti and Permanent Representative of the Republic of Poland to the African Union. Afterwards, from 2012 to 2017 he was Minister-Counsellor at the Department of Africa and the Middle East. For the next year he was at the Consular Department. Since 2018 he is representing Poland to the Philippines as chargé d'affaires. Beside Polish, he speaks English and French. == References == Category:1960s births Category:Ambassadors of Poland to Ethiopia Category:Ambassadors of Poland to the Philippines Category:Living people Category:John Paul II Catholic University of Lublin alumni
title: Jarosław Szczepankiewicz
